review.reviewBody: The fingers and thumbs on these are a bit too long. Otherwise, they're pretty comfortable for the price. I haven't used them long enough to comment on the durability.
review.name: The fingers and thumbs on

review.reviewBody: Seem durable, and I'm happy with it as general-purpose easy mountaineering gloves. For climbing, the fit is off for me. Fingers are 0.5-1 cm too long, no bueno for working with carabiners. Strangely enough, this only affect thumb, index and middle finger - ring and pinky finger fit perfectly. My palm is 9 cm wide, 21 cm circumference, index finger 8.5 cm, middle 9 cm, gloves size is L.
review.name: Strong, comfortable, but not ideal fit

review.reviewBody: So far these gloves have been great for basic use. They are durable and protective. The large wrist wrap holds them on well. I believe they will last. The sizing is accurate. I would buy another pair in the future.
review.name: Black Diamond Crag Gloves

review.reviewBody: Seams of gloves have blown within the first few days of use multiple times, but good price and relatively comfortable
review.name: Comfortable but show use quickly

review.reviewBody: Glove fit well following the recommended size chart. Definitely good quality and seems durable, but still thin enough for good dexterity. Only issue I have is with overall comfort with these gloves, they have pretty rigid seams which protrude from the inside of the glove. Really not very comfortable with seams running in between every finger. Hopefully they will soften with use, will keep and still use!
review.name: Good gloves, one issue

review.reviewBody: I wish the seams were softer, but otherwise a good fit and design.
review.name: Good except...

review.reviewBody: Solid belay gloves that get the job done. A snug, but not tight, fit results in great dexterity while belaying. The back of the glove is a very breathable material so hands don't get sweaty in the gloves.
review.name: Snug fit and breathable gloves

review.reviewBody: Great durable for climbing and belaying. Use for search and rescue
review.name: Durable

review.reviewBody: I've previously used cheap Silicone gardening gloves down slot canyons, but these gloves have exceeded my expectations. They are durable, comfortable, with the dexterity needed for rope work.
review.name: Great Canyoneering Glove

review.reviewBody:
I bought them online
 I can use a liner under them as well. very flexible and simple movements to grab rope.
review.name: I bought them online I

description: Buy the Mammut 4 Slide Climbing Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 4 Slide Climbing Harness
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut 4 Slide Climbing Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: We use these to belay on shift at my climbing gym and the large pads make them very comfortable during long belays. Great harness for those working indoors at a gym with new climbers.

So I hung on it in the was clipped my PAS into and anchor, the sides my hips dug in a bit. It's not as comfortable and my misty mountain cadilac, but it's not bad. I could totally do a hanging belay. Rappeling or lowering in gym seem totally fine. I don't notice in when climbing. So over all I think it's pretty comfortable harness. Nothing to complain about.
review.name: It's great so far for gym and everything

review.reviewBody:
Great harness with a wide range of fit!

I am on the larger size of humans, and this harness fits great!

The waist cinches down from both sides of the harness vs only from one side like my previous harness. This makes the harness stay more centered on my body, and therefore more comfortable to climb in.
review.name: Super Comfy

review.reviewBody: Comfy supportive and adjustable
review.name: Comfy and supportive

review.reviewBody: Pads are not super comfortable compared with Black Diamonds Momentum harness. However this harness is much lighter and gets the job done with sport climbs.

I love this harness! It’s incredibly comfortable and well padded. If you don’t mind the extra bulk that comes with that, this is a great choice for you! It feels very durable and well-made. The one issue that I’ve had with it is that it takes a bit longer to don, however this is something that I personally don’t mind, as I love the extra comfort this provides. I think this is a great product for beginners and intermediate-experts in gym or outdoor environments.
review.name: Great harness!

review.reviewBody: Nice harness overall. The buckles allow for ample amounts of tightening up. It’s comfy while climbing. Price is right.
review.name: Great harness

review.reviewBody: Super high quality. Plus the 4 way adjustment is super convenient for that perfect fit.

I am a total beginner so I may be wearing it wrong, but I purchased these along with the Selenas to see which ones worked for me.. I tried both of them a few times on an auto-belay system. After trying the 4-slide I felt like the metal strap fasteners were digging into my thigh. I had them at a snug setting, just enough where it wouldn't squeeze. Now writing this post I realized I should've loosened it so that it may have helped. Other than that I love the padding on the waist and the amount of adjustments available on the strap!
review.name: Great but uncomfortable on the thigh

review.reviewBody:
As someone who is getting more and more into climbing, I typically want to look for a lighter yet equally effective harness as my previous BD Solution harnesses with generous gear loops, but the light-weighted nature of the Mammut Sender harness.

This 4-Slide Harness is a little too much for me, mainly because I'm lazy and would prefer the single buckle adjustment as opposed to adjusting all 4. While it is definitely amazing for adjustment and even to share between friends of similar waist size, I would want something a bit lighter and less finnicky in terms of time taken to put on.
review.name: Phenomenal All-round Harness

name: 4 Slide Climbing Harness

description: Buy the Matador Freerain22 Waterproof Packable 22L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Freerain22 Waterproof Packable 22L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Matador Freerain22 Waterproof Packable 22L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Purchase to use as a day hike pack. Third day hike and the shell has a tear (maybe a branch scraped it while I was walking??). First of all, if it was meant for day hikes and it’s being used for exactly that purpose it should be able to withstand a day hike. Especially one that’s not even highly technical!! Secondly with this tear, the pack is no longer waterproof rendering it useless to me as I’m in Patagonia where it rains sporadically. Frustrated and not worth the money. Matador needs to make this product better or change the description about how it’s meant to be used.
review.name: Not made for the trail or the city

review.reviewBody:
This bag came to my attention from a rave review on the New York Times' Wirecutter site.

I was looking for a new, more packable bag to wear on long multi-pitch climbing days. 

First, the good: it packs down to nothing, holds way more than you think it will (1 liter water bottle, shoes, puffy jacket, collapsed trekking poles, snacks). 

Now, the bad:  thin material began visibly abrading and breaking down after contact with the rock on the first day, the small pouch on the front doesn't include an interior clip for keys, and opens in a manner that could lead things to fall out unless you hold the bag sideways. Last but not least, the drink holders on the side don't have any straps to keep the drinks in. I'm not confident that this bag would make it through a month of climbing, let alone a year or more. A tough pill to swallow given the price point.

If you want something fashionable and packable for the city, or a simple day of hiking, this bag is probably great. For more active outdoor endeavors, consider a more durable, but slightly less packable, bag made of a Cordura-type fabric.
review.name: Perfect For The City, Not The Crag

name: Freerain22 Waterproof Packable 22L Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shorts are super lightweight and comfortable in hot and humid weather. They stay perfectly in place thanks to the liner. The pocket on the back is just big enough to fit my phone in which is a bonus.
review.name: Great shorts!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these shorts, but when wearing them for running or hiking my thighs chafe. This isn't a problem an older model of the shorts. Nevertheless, the fit is very comfortable and they are great for low-impact activities. Additionally, they are extremely odor resistant!
review.name: Great shorts, but thigh chafing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wanted shorts with built in liner for around the house and running errands. These meet those needs. Comfy and soft.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I appreciate that these shorts are not made with synthetic fibers because the air does flow through the fabric to cool you down when running in high temperatures. What a relief that is. They are my favorite running shorts of all time now. I bought both colors and they are gorgeous. The waistband is so comfortable which is a huge plus for me. They are a little bit low rise if you are tall like me. They could have a bit of a longer rise for us tall girls but they'll do. They are still very comfortable and I will purchase these shorts again and again. They are true to size. I always wear medium in running shorts and its the same with these shorts.
review.name: Excellent hot weather shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are really comfortable, true to size, I love the back pocket for my cell phone
review.name: My go to running shorts, all not need any others

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the most comfortable athletic shorts I've ever worn. They are soft, light, and - bonus - flattering.
review.name: The perfect short

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have owned three of these and I’ve never had to replace one due to failure. I used one for 8 years of Military service as an infantryman in Arctic, jungle, and desert environments. This product never let me down. Since then I have bought two more. I love these and I expect them to last me a lifetime as a civilian hiker / camper. I highly recommend this product for someone who needs a sleep pad that will keep comfortable all over the world when used properly and with a sleep system.
review.name: Comfortable and Durable!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I´ve used this StoS sleeping mat on a 5-day kayak trip, and it´s been great so far. I have tried many different air sleeping mats over the years, and they´ve all disappointed me at some point, so let´s see how it goes with this one!
Of course, I put a regular foam Z-type mat under the air mat, because after learning the hard way, I don´t want to wake up sleeping on the floor anymore.
review.name: Is this the one?

review.reviewBody: This is the worst sleeping pad I have ever used! The thing does not stay inflated by morning it is flat no matter what I do and under what conditions I use it. In addition, the gray portion of the stuff / pump sack ripped off within 1.5 years of use. I purchased this pad because it got good reviews especially for side sleepers and those with back pain. It turns out the only good thing this is good for is to add additional weight to your pack....I can find better uses for that space and weight. Not sure how this thing got all the awards and good reviews but it certainty will not get one from this user.
review.name: DO NOT BUY - take it from someone with 20+ years of experience

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this pad! For the comfort it provides, I do not mind the extra space it takes. I kayak camp so the added weight is no issue at all. I sleep so well on this pad! I love that you can blow the bottom up separately to provide more cushion especially if there are tree roots. So happy with my purchase.
review.name: Best

review.reviewBody: Great pad. Comfortable and easy to inflate. Does wonderful in Cold weather. Have used it on the Appalachian trail in January February and June. No problems.
review.name: Pad

review.reviewBody: I used to think I'd never get a good night's sleep in the backcountry. The Comfort Plus Insulated Air mat has changed that! The dual-layer system lets me customize a softer sleeping surface while keeping the bottom layer fully inflated to protect from hard ground. And I love that it provides redundancy in case of puncture, though I've been using it for years and have never worried about its durability. The only drawbacks are weight and packed size, but it's still my go-to pad for most trips because sleeping well and comfortably makes everything else better, too!
review.name: Comfort Plus is a game-changer!

review.reviewBody: I bought this sleeping mat for the first time in 2016. I was stationed in Alaska as an Airborne Infantryman in the United States Army. This sleeping pad endured for 3 years in that environment. It held up in 40+ Airborne exercises in extreme cold temperatures for weeks at a time and a deployment to Afghanistan. Sleeping on it was something I always looked forward too. It continued to serve me well leading into 2022 when I finally passed it on to a friend and bought me a new one. The new one served me well in the swamps of Louisiana and the blistering heat of Eastern North Carolina while on active duty and even now, as a civilian, it is still going strong. Treated with respect, I imagine this pad will last the average person the better part of a decade. I have never had one fail in any way, but if it does and you forgot your included patch kit, it is compartmentalized, so the opposite half will retain air. To this day, I use it for camping and I keep it deployed full-time in a spare bedroom where I still sleep on it occasionally. It is very comfortable and effective. I highly recommend this product.
review.name: Arctic Airborne Infantry Certified

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Most comfortable pad ever, although its the first "good" pad iv tried it definitely sets a new standard for everything i sleep on (bed or otherwise) from this day forth. If its in the budget pull the trigger, otherwise there are cheaper ones that will work just fine. Don't get too caught up in R ratings unless your goin into some nasty nasty weather then you're going to splurge on all your gear anyways.
review.name: Cloud9

review.reviewBody: First off, I love my Comfort plus. As a side sleeper it’s always difficult to find a comfortable sleeping pad. I tend to camp in cold weather and during the last cold camp it got down to 16°f. My toes were cold in my 0° sleeping bag but that was it. I’d say my biggest complaint is that it skids around on my silpoly tent floor. I wish they still made the Comfort Plus in a rectangular model. The weight difference wasn’t that dramatic and I could keep my feet off the ground. All in all, a great pad for packed size, R value and comfort.
review.name: Slick sleeping surface

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best pack friendly mattress out their hands down. Used in 12 degree snow and in the summer. Had to replace one my dog tore up while out getting supplies.
review.name: Great Buy!!

name: Comfort Plus Insulated Sleeping Pad
Comfort Plus Insulated Sleeping Pad

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro HV 120 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve been skiing for 50 years, this is my favorite boot! From double black to skiing green with family, the boot is comfortable and responsive.

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro HV 120 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have a VERY high insole, and was recommended this one over my Atomics. The fit was very tight, despite having ample room lengthwise (the very last notch on all buckles is used), and it just didn’t work. In the end I had to simply bin the inner shoe, and used the old one from Atomic (a whole size bigger). That dramatically improved the situation, and tested over two weeks. The control is much sharper for sure, and certainly comfortable enough to forget about them.
review.name: Tight fit but otherwise brilliant

review.itemreviewed: S/Pro HV 120 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's
review.reviewBody: For the first time in my life I have a boot that offers excellent control and supreme comfort without compromise. My feet are rather wide and it’s been so hard to find high performance boots that don’t crush the life out of my chunky feet. My local ski shop custom molded them and now when I’m flying down the mountains my feet feel like they’re being cradled by snuggly soft kittens. These really are the best of both worlds.
review.name: Fat feet Freedom!

name: S/Pro HV 120 GW Ski Boot - 2025 - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the SteriPEN Classic 3 Handheld Water Purifier online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Works fantastic, absolutely essential. Only reason I gave 4 stars is because I would absolutely recommend getting a rechargeable pen instead of carrying batteries
review.name: Essential piece of kit

review.reviewBody: Great tool for hiking, backpacking, and having for emergency sterilization. At home in case of a loss of domestic water
review.name: Easy to use and compact to carry

review.reviewBody: I have had this for over six months, used on several camping and hunting trips, great options, especially when there is running water everywhere you are going
review.name: Works great, easy to use, has held up well so far

review.reviewBody: Great purifier, light, easy to find AA batteries. Lighter but also larger than my other similar device. Weight is good for the trail
review.name: Great, simple, functional

review.reviewBody: Works great on mountain hunts, It does have some battery issues. The temperatures were 35 over night and i had to take the batteries out and put them back in in the morning

Took this on a backcountry camping trip for 8 days. Our campsite was near a spring, and the Classic 3 allowed us to sterilize our water each day. This was a quick process and gave us peace of mind that any bacteria, viruses, or other organisms were killed prior to our consumption. 

The issue encountered was the UV lamp would take a couple attempts to fully illuminate in colder weather (40F). Between cold batteries and a cold Classic 3, the device would either fail with a red "X" or say a treatment was successful without the UV light fully illuminating. I found the best action was to warm the batteries and Classic 3 in my pockets prior to use. Once I did that, the Classic 3 worked as expected about 95% of the time. The 5% it didn't work, it would fail for an unknown reason and I'd restart the treatment with success on either the 2nd or 3rd try.

Overall, this product worked for my group. In comparison to a hand-pump filter, this Classic 3 was more convenient.
review.name: Perfect for the Backcountry

review.reviewBody: Works great, easy to use, dependable way to get safe water.
A bottle full of Mt Baker lake and a little uv light makes me not get sick, 10/10 would recommend

Pros:
-light weight 
-easy to use
-batteries can be found anywhere
-no taste like other methods of sterilization (iodine/ chlorine)
Cons:
-need to carry spare batteries
-takes 90 seconds of stirring

I have had this product for a couple years now and it still works great. I've never gotten sick from drinking the water from it. It is really great for backpacking and travel in less developed country. If you use the lithium AA's it really takes forever to run  out. However it's always a good idea to have spare batteries.
review.name: Great Way to Sterilize Water

name: Classic 3 Handheld Water Purifier

review.reviewBody: Purchased this tent as a 4-season mountaineering tent. Tent pole snapped while setting it up in my home before taking it out in the elements. Followed the directions and tent pole snapped near the insertion point. Clearly manufacturing defect or problems with 1-3 step process. I suspect that the poles need to be tensioned in reverse order because of how the sleeves are stacked. The nylon pole tubes are already coming unravelled. Not sure I would want to set this up in the backyard much less in winter weather or in the mountains. Absolutely do not recommend this. I also have not heard from customer service when sending receipt and information related to the snapped poles.
review.name: Absolute Garbage
comment:
We sincerely apologize for the issue you experienced with your Samaya2.5.

For the assembly, Samaya does have a tutorial that provides a step-by-step guide at the following link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mR_wpgMoPoU. One important step is to pre-insert the three poles in the recommended order and use the adjuster to create tension by pulling on the strap, not the pole.

However, we completely understand that even with the correct process, a pole may still have broken. Samaya uses DAC poles, which are known for their reliability, but an occasional manufacturing defect can happen, and it seems this might be the case here.

Please be assured the Samaya team is handling your request, and they've taken all necessary measures to ensure your tent is back in perfect condition.

Wishing you many more comfortable nights ahead in your Samaya2.5!

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent to lower the weight for backpacking and bikepacking. This is a great tent. I used it 3 times and each time, I was amazed by the experience. i also bought the vestibule.I own the Samaya basecamp and the alpine 35L backpack as well.  I own many tents, Hilleberg, Mountain Hardwear, Exped and this is my preferred. Very robust but super light.
review.name: LOVE this tent!

review.reviewBody:
To sum it up: great idea, attrocious execution.

The first time I tried to set it up:
1. One of the pole sleeves ripped immediately,
2. One of the poles broke in two places.

Returned right away. Thank you, backcountry.com for making the process as painless as possible!
review.name: VERY Disappointing

name: Samaya2.5 Tent

review.reviewBody: I have a pair of Privateers from a few years ago, size 43.5   I ordered size 44 in the Recon and they are very large for my feet both in sole length and and overall volume.  Im size 10.5 usa and the size chart indicated a 44, way off for my feet.  Quality of material and build seems to be lower than my old Privateers. Sent back and cost me $7 to do so. Boo...Sorry.
review.name: Runs large

review.reviewBody:
I had a pair of Giro Privateer shoes that fit well but the tan sole material was worthless. there was no traction on rocks. They were so slick they were dangerous.

I spotted these Rincon shoes with the dark sole on the black version, thinking it would offer good traction. The traction is better, but not nearly what's required for a good mountain shoe.

The fit is excellent. The build quality is good. They could have a stiffer sole. The traction is poor in cool conditions or on wet rocks. I wish the compound were better. Perhaps Vibram or something similar would make these shoes shine.
review.name: Poor off-bike traction

review.reviewBody: These shoes have great adjustability and comfort. Best shoe is the price range. Only wish it had a slightly stiffer sole to have optimum power transfer but more than get the job done. Great ventilation and quick drying of they get wet on trail. Tread is also nice for when walking a trail.
review.name: Nearly Perfect

name: Rincon Cycling Shoe - Men's

xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: Love love love these boots! True to size and so comfortable. Easy to get on and off. Tempted to buy an extra pair.
review.name: Love these boots!

review.reviewBody: Got it for a Christmas gift for my mom. She loves them! She said they are super comfortable and she wears them.all.the time
review.name: Great gift
comment: Thank you for the 5 star review!  We appreciate the positive feedback and hope you continue to be an Xtratuf supporter!

review.reviewBody: I loved these when I first got these, after the first wear I noticed the boots creased badly and stayed that way ever since but I figured that was how they are made.  They claim to be leather but the feel more like plastic or a very low quality leather composite, and they are painted. That has been the worst part, the color is rubbing off on the toes of these boots so now they look to have whitish red streaks all over, I purchased these boots about 2 months ago and have worn them a handful of times and they have not held up well at all. The sizing is also all over the place! I do not understand why they cannot get women’s sizing correct, I wear an 8 1/2 usually so I purchased a 9 in the legacy Chelsea boot and they are very roomy; I previously purchased the legacy lte boots and had to order two sizes up to find the correct size! Overall, cute and comfortable but sizing and quality leave much to be desired. I would not recommend these boots.
review.name: Poor quality
comment:
Hello,
We are sorry to hear that these boots were not what you expected.  Please reach out to us so we can get this resolved and make sure you are 100% satisfied with your purchase. xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: These boots are my new favorite!! I’ve had many pairs of Xtratuf boots over the years but these are the best ones yet. They fit great and are well made and not to mention how cute they are!! They are worth the price, you won’t regret ordering them!!
review.name: Quality and so Cute!

review.reviewBody: Love these as my new daily winter town boot. Snug at first but they break in nicely. Very comfortable and surprisingly warm.
review.name: New daily go to

review.reviewBody: YES! These are amazing! While I don't live in Alaska I do live in the PNW and we get  a lot of weather, specifically rain. I've had other brands even other styles of XTRAs but these are the BEST!  No rubbing on my shin or back of my calf. Very comfy inside without feeling like I'm wearing a stiff boot or a fuzzy slipper (you know what I mean). And they look fantastic! I was surprised how fancy they look without being fussy plus they pass the no sock test!
review.name: Thank God!

review.reviewBody: Excellent boot, but these run at least a half size small. I have many pair of XtraTuf boots, all in size 8. I ordered these in 8s and can barely squeeze my feet in them wearing thin socks.
review.name: Great boot, runs small

review.reviewBody: They fit small and didn’t come up as high as I’d like.
review.name: Not great!

description: Buy the Tecnica Cochise 130 Dyn Alpine Touring Boot - 2023 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cochise 130 Dyn Alpine Touring Boot - 2023
hasVariant.description: Buy the Tecnica Cochise 130 Dyn Alpine Touring Boot - 2023 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have used this boot about 90 days, having owned it 14 months. It's among the top boots of my life, and I would be happy to use it for resort and "side-country" skiing for the foreseeable future. It's responsive, comfortable, and at this point very dialed into my foot.

The grip-walk sole, however, is in dire need of improvement. It is simply too soft. I have replaced the soles twice now, just from parking lot walks and maybe 20 touring days. I estimate the sole lasts about 30 days of this kind of normal use. Imagine if that were the case for your hiking boots! It would be preposterous.

Based on the wear to the toe lip, I expect I will get maybe 100 more days on these before they become unusable. Hardening the plastics in the toe and heel would go a long way toward durability and longevity.
review.name: Powerful do-it-all boot with one unfortunate flaw

review.reviewBody: Love this boot. It truly does it all. Just wish they would go back to their orange color from a few years back. This reddish color clashes with my whole setup that I spent a lot of money on.
review.name: Great boot. Ugly Color

review.reviewBody: I bought this boot after trying a few different pairs.  They are outstanding.  Solidly built with an extremely comfortable yet tight fitting liner.  I heat molded the liner and have an excellent fit.  Power transmission on the slopes is precise and effecient.  The walk mode is great.  Easy to engage and disengage with a large degree of movement.  I have a relatively narrow foot, but the LV boots I tried were too tight.  These are perfect.
review.name: Perfect boot

review.reviewBody:
Ho usato tanti scarponi diversi, ma da quando sono passato a Cochise 130 ho praticamente rinunciato al resto. Scarpone unico!
Flex perfetto.. Last ideale.. Ottimo in tutte le occasioni.
Lo uso tranquillamente sia per uscite easy in moderato skialp, ma tanto e soprattutto in freeride. Anche con sci race da pista ho una sensazione di precisione e stabilità come mai me lo sarei aspettato.
Super!
review.name: Il meglio che si possa desiderare.

name: Cochise 130 Dyn Alpine Touring Boot - 2023

description: Buy the Assos GTO NS DermaSensor Baselayer - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GTO NS DermaSensor Baselayer - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Assos GTO NS DermaSensor Baselayer - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Finally, a summer base layer that actually works! This product is absurdly expensive, but it does what a summer base layer is supposed to do, it works like a radiator on a (gas powered) car. Meaning, it keeps you cooler on hot climbs by pulling the moisture away from your body and providing evaporative cooling, and dries extremely fast to provide insulation (warmth) on descents. I live in CO and these attributes are very important. I've always bought into the Assos layering system and tried many versions of their base layers for summer rides. This is the first and only product that actually does what the Assos layering system advertises. The theory is great but if the materials don't actually provide the cooling and insulation, it's just a way to be overheated climbing and cold descending. I use this product on every ride, even in the winter. For fit, go with smaller, it's a very stretchy material, to get the next to skin fit.
review.name: It Actually Works

name: GTO NS DermaSensor Baselayer - Men's

review.reviewBody: Really like the fit and feel of these gloves. However, the stitch quality is not great. After a couple hundred miles, the seams around the thumb are coming apart.

review.reviewBody:
This is the first new pair of Castelli gloves I have purchased in over 10 years after wearing mostly PEARL iZUMi and Giordana gloves. They feel and look slim, padding is average with a small square of gel at the heel of the palm, but I would prefer a different placement/size of the main pad that sits just below the base of the fingers.

Be aware that these run small like most of Castelli's gear. According to Castelli's size chart, my hand measurement is just a tad below the size break between medium and large. I went with a large and the fit is nearly perfect...snug without being restrictive.
review.name: Nice gloves for road use

review.reviewBody: I am a fan of the chromapop lenses. They are great. Unfortunately the rubber nose pads started deteriorating during my second fishing season wearing them. I should have contacted them immediately but I figured I could get replacement pads eventually but smith does not offer that as an option. After three summers fishing, I cannot wear them anymore. For this reason I have to give 3 stars.
review.name: Longevity issues

review.reviewBody: Love the shout-out polarized sunglasses! I wish I got the glossy frames instead of the matte as they look more masculine in the matte, but oh well.
review.name: Love the shout-out polarized sunglasses!

review.reviewBody:
Sustains: styling, glass, quality, stats put while active. These are my favorite glasses I’ve owned

Improves: frame is squeaky, a small rubberized patch on the inside of the legs like there is on the bridge of the nose would be great.
review.name: Smith Shoutouts - winners!

review.reviewBody: Never seen a greener green. Love these, so clear, and they stay on doing almost anything.
review.name: They really do “Pop”

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my grandson, his request. He’s a climber and loves them.
review.name: Bought these for my grandson,

review.reviewBody:
My dog chewed my Smith’s. I had them for at least five years! I HAD to have Smiths fir my new ones!! 
I love the quality! I will only own Smith sunglasses!
review.name: My dog chewed my Smith’s.

review.reviewBody: Expensive sunglasses, but they have a cheap plastic feel/sound to them when taking them on/off or folding the frame.
review.name: Shoutout OK

review.reviewBody: I have a hard time finding glasses to fit my head, the Shoutout provides a broad width coverage that sits securely on the temples and the bridge of my nose.
review.name: Great fit and look

review.reviewBody: We’ve bought Smith’s for years and love the quality, the UV protection, and the way it sits and fits to your face, it’s a fantastic product.
review.name: We’ve bought Smith’s for years

review.reviewBody: New glasses are a warranty claim and the process was incredibly easy.
review.name: Warranty ease

description: Buy the Topeak Mini Dual DXG Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mini Dual DXG Pump
hasVariant.description: Buy the Topeak Mini Dual DXG Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is a great pump, very efficient as it pumps on both strokes. Plus it has a pressure gauge so you can see you are making progress and get the tire to a pressure that is adequate for the rest of a long ride. The one downside is that the pump mount only works for the front downtube which on many bikes is very wide and flat. The mount that comes with the pump only works for narrow round tubes. And the mount is unidirectional so it can't go on the seat tube. So now I'm carrying the pump in my jersey pocket, and hope I don't forget it the next time I'm out riding and get a flat tire!
review.name: Great pump but doesn't fit frame

name: Mini Dual DXG Pump

description: Buy the HOKA Bondi 8 Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bondi 8 Running Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the HOKA Bondi 8 Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Beautiful boots and super quick delivery
review.name: Boots

review.reviewBody: These were the most uncomfortable shoes I've ever worn. My feet were so achy after my 8 hour shift. I exchanged them for a different style.
review.name: If I could, I'd give zero stars

review.reviewBody: This is my11th pair of Hoka Bondi's so I think you know I love them. Most comfortable shoes I've had. I have flat feet, bad back and love to walk. I went through many brands until I found Hoka. They are pricey but so worth it. I'm waiting for a red color. I love pops of color.
review.name: Love my Bondi's

review.reviewBody: Standing, working & walking every day, all day.. My back, legs and feet are not hurting..
review.name: OMG!!! I Love my bondi 8...

review.reviewBody: My shoes fit perfectly (7.5) but when I tied my shoes the lip of the shoe literally cuts into my skin by the end of my work day. So weird so will get an 8 in the future. Otherwise the shoe itself does it job for my chronic pain (I work in a hospital) and performs better then Nikes in that respect
review.name: Go a half sized up

review.reviewBody: I love my Bondi 8!! It's wide on the front for toes to spread out, super comfy with its elevated sole. My daughter recommended the Bondi 8 to me, and I have no regrets. Got my husband to purchase one too.
review.name: My favorite Hoka!!

review.reviewBody: I ended up purchasing 4 pairs of shoes in increasingly larger sizes to accommodate a swollen foot and ankle brace from a broken fibula. Unfortunately, the box was thrown out on one pair so I can't return it. Returned one pair and keeping the other two in different sizes. I typically wear a size 9 in athletic shoes but the 9.5 wide fits perfectly and feels great on my normal foot. Just hoping the 10 wide will be as comfortable on the swollen foot!
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: I am so ticked off that I paid over $150 for these shoes. Warranty is a joke. They want me to send them back for evaluation and go without shoes. Hole broke in less than 2 months of wear due to the lace hole being punched too close. It is an obvious defect. They should send me a new pair and then I would send these back. Because of this I will do a full return and buy different brand from here on out. Hoka is not what it used to be :O(
review.name: JUNK

review.reviewBody: Comfortable. Excellent support. My feet feel rested after a long 12-hour shift.
review.name: I will order again.

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Bondi's. There is ample room for the toes. Perhaps a little wider than I want but they do maintain support. I find these shoes work best on a treadmill and for squats.
review.name: COMFY AND SUPPORTIVE

name: Bondi 8 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is a great helmet for the price. The fit is spot on. It's well padded. Has a 3-position visor. There's a magnetic chin strap buckle. It's cool.
review.name: Great Helmet

review.reviewBody: This is a great helmet that deserves more looks from serious riders.  Don't be fooled by the lower price point.  It's light, comfortable, and very feature rich for the price.  I took a chance because of the impact rating and glad I did.  The KinetiCore is super comfortable and makes the helmet feel lighter than it is (which is not heavy).  The visor is not removable, but three different positions stay in place.  The dial adjustments works just like any other helmet, and it has these channels for eyewear arms that seems to work.  The buckle and straps have plenty of adjustment, and removes easy with one hand.
review.name: Deserves more love

name: Coyote Kineticore Helmet

review.reviewBody: I love these so much I got 2 pairs! At the price point and being EVA, I didn't have super high expectations for these, just thought they were going to be like the rest of my similar slip-on/slide sandals, but I have been blown away by them so far. They are SO comfortable and have an incredible footbed. I've been wearing these all summer around the house, running errands, to concerts, and anytime I'm on the way to go do a sport where I don't want to wear the sport footwear until it's time for them, like my paddle shoes or hiking boots. They're also great for hiking/backpacking, as they're great camp shoes and for river/creek crossings. 10/10, highly recommended! I recently got the gold and they are FABULOUS! I have very narrow feet and these are perfect. I wear an 8.5 in sandals and 9 street/running shoe and got the 39. They fit right on the money but I do think the 40 would be close enough to work, too.
review.name: LOVE THEM!!!!

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite shoes to throw on when I'm running out of the house. They are so comfortable and I love all of the fun colors they come in! They are also perfect for a pool or beach day. Every time I wear out the soles I am quick to buy a new pair. I would say, like all Birkenstocks, they run a little large. I am usually a size 6 in shoes and order a size 36 in theirs.
review.name: My favorite sandals

name: Arizona EVA Narrow Sandal - Women's

hasVariant.name: Black Hole MLC 45L Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Black Hole MLC 45L Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I had the old (shiny) MLC 45 and quite liked it, took it on some month-long trips as my only bag and was convinced i’d have it forever. However since the new model was released I was intrigued at the changes and figured i’d get it for my next trip. 

I’m at the airport heading home and the short version is this: the new version is better than the old in every way. it has a lot of strengths, only a few issues/drawbacks, and I’d score it a 9/10

PROS:
- new recycled tpu coating (the matte finish) is a substantial improvement. it feels textured and nice and looks great, in sunlight there’s almost a sparkle coming off the pattern. it also does a better job of resisting water and scuffs. whereas the shiny surface like to accumulate white marks and proof of impacts, new one seems to wipe clean everything I’ve thrown at it
- organization makes a lot more sense now. before there were two pockets on the outside and a padded tech pouch on BOTH sides, now there’s a padded pouch and organization on the back and no openings on the front. this increases security substantially and makes packing simpler, but the biggest impact was i felt more comfortable throwing my bag down and knowing which side to keep upright. 
- compression straps are an impactful addition and the new daisy chain location and straps for long gear are both more practical and better looking than before
-the bag looks MUCH better in person than before. it’s professional enough to bring into p much any office space, lowkey enough so that it just looks like a backpack (or duffel/briefcase if u carry it that way), and doesn’t attract unwanted attention
UNCHANGED AND AWESOME
-this thing holds a ton of stuff, it did before and does so now. i overpacked on this trip and can still tighten the compression straps
- being able to stow the backpack straps and carry it as a briefcase or duffel or shoulder bag is great versatility. i know some others do this (like aer tp3) but patagonia’s clamshell design and admin pocket make a world of difference in practicality 
NOT STOKED ON
- i would love a small access pocket on the top like the mini-MLC has. would be perfect for stowing pocket things and keeping them nearby when it’s a backpack. 

aight planes leaving happy travels y’all
review.name: New MLC is much upgraded, almost perfect

name: Black Hole MLC 45L Bag

review.reviewBody: Order these as one size larger. They are a small fit. Not true to size!!
review.name: Small Fit... Nice shoe

review.reviewBody: The shoes are great but they fit small. Also the toe box is not as wide as I was hoping. But overall is a good shoe if you can get the fit right. I was unable to return/exchange for a different size due to have worn them (1) time before deciding they were snug.
review.name: Brewer review

review.reviewBody: Solid kayaking shoe for protecting dry suit booties.  Size up one size to one-and-a-half sizes for the booties!
review.name: Great kayaking shoe

review.reviewBody: This shoe is a classic with a super comfortable design and easy slip-on use
review.name: A new classic

review.reviewBody: Second pair I've owned,  I love them. Let me know if you ever plan on discontinuing them so I can order 6 pair, lol
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: Great shoes, very comfortable and the grip on wet rocks is super. Impressed with Astral’s service.
review.name: Grippy

review.reviewBody: Great water shoe and also great for everyday causal wear too
review.name: Two thumbs up

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, very versatile. The concept is great, a shoe that you don’t need to wear a sock and can go anywhere including water. This is my goto shoe. Worth every penny!
review.name: Worth every penny!

review.reviewBody: I do a lot of outdoor sports and hate having too much gear. Can't I just go caving in an old pair of running shoes? Are approach shoes necessary? Do I need ultralight camp shoes for backpacking? It can be too much. So I was hesitant to buy my first pair of Astrals. What tipped the scales was a backpacking trip in the PNW with some potentially dangerous glacial stream crossings. So I bought these for that purpose: light enough to carry in addition to my trail runners, sticky rubber that excels on river rock, and quick draining/drying features. The shoe delivered. BUT, the best part is that they aren't a specialist shoe. While I did cruise across about 10 different streams in them, I also found the zero drop a welcome change on my feet after a long day of hiking, so they became a camp shoe. I wore them in the airport and around Portland while in transit. I even had an extra day and went downhill mountain biking in them at the Timberline Bike Park. I'll probably wear them to work, and no one will know that I've been rocking them without socks all summer too. If they were only good for rivers, I'd have been a little ashamed of purchasing them for such a niche usage and for the one summer trip. Instead, they are what I reach for on a daily basis, and I've already gotten my money's worth.
review.name: Did I really need another shoe? Turns out, yes.

review.reviewBody:
Great kicks! I'm on my 3rd pair. 
Most versatile pair of shoes I own. River to trail to city mileage, these are where its at.
review.name: Super versatile!

name: Brewer 2 Water Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bicycle during the coldest winter days and use these overtop of either knit gloves or heavy leather gloves, depending on the temps. Fingers stay comfortable warm and dry.
review.name: Perfect for my needs

review.reviewBody: I used the Revel Shell Mitts to climb multiple mountains. They allow for a much easier mitt change during intense ascents while also providing the option to keep a mitten or glove underneath. During my winter exercises as part of my military duties, they allowed me to manipulate my weapon quickly without freezing my hands, especially when combined with a pair of Vigor Lightweight or Medium Sensor gloves. The combination of these two gloves is just perfect from -10 to -20 degrees.
review.name: Army and hiking

review.reviewBody: These are the cats meow. I put a thin pair of the merino wool mitts on the inside and wow. Perfect pairing. Even on their own they rock. Must have for anyone one who plays outside in the spring or anytime really.
review.name: Awesome shell mitts.

review.reviewBody: I bought these one size up, to fit over the inner mitt of the OR Alti Mitts.  They fit perfectly and the grip on the hiking poles is phenomenal.  Of course wind and waterproof, so actually added a bit of noticeable warmth as well.  First test up Tucks on Mt Washington to the bowl and these were perfect in “mild” conditions - 15mph winds and 20d F.  Above this, put the Alti outer mitten on.
review.name: Wow, the grip on these things

review.reviewBody: These mitts are lightweight but do a great job of blocking wind and water. I use some flurry gloves underneath them in the cold weather or just use the shells by themselves for shoulder seasons.
review.name: Great shell mitts

review.reviewBody: They chose a mechanism for cinching the cuff that requires two hands - and I only have one hand available to use!  My old shell mitts (REI) are a very similar design and only require one hand to cinch.  I'm returning these due to the baffling design fail.
review.name: Inexplicably bad design

review.reviewBody: Wore this on top of my Sureshot Heated Softshell Gloves and after a day of skiing my globes were wet.
review.name: Not Water Proof as advertise

review.reviewBody: This is a perfect item to complement my glove quiver.
review.name: A necessity.

review.reviewBody: The shell overmitts allow me to wear summer cycling gloves inside them in mild rainy weather. In colder weather, I can wear a warmer layer inside. The mittens are my choice for wet-weather riding. Wet or dry, the palm material is grippy on the handlebars. This is a superb feature. The long gauntlet with drawstring and cord-lock allows me to seal out the wind at my jacket's cuffs. In rainy weather, I shingle the gauntlets under my sleeves to keep rainwater out of the mittens. These 2021 mittens replace my earlier pair which wore out (surprise!) after about ten years of winter commuting - almost daily - in eastern Ontario (often at -20C). The new version seems even better-built than my originals.
review.name: Excellent for cycling.

review.reviewBody: Used these with the OR flurry gloves snowshoeing. Performed as expected and the expectations were high. Will be buying a second pair for the wife. Would highly recommend however hard to get at the moment.
review.name: Perfect mitts for a variety of conditions

name: Revel Shell Mitten

review.reviewBody: I have purchased these shoes for many years and find them to hold up well and keep my feet comfortable and dry.
review.name: Comfortable dry shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They are very comfortable shoes out of the box they are my favor I wear it all the time
review.name: They are very comfortable shoes

review.reviewBody: Great shoes, the insoles that come with them hurt the outside of my foot so I'm getting the k20 insoles to fix the issue
review.name: Great shoes, the insoles that

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely comfortable. Super snug but also not too tight on your foot. Great for walking through the woods and up and down terrain or just walking through the neighborhood. Super comfy.
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit and comfort is excellent. Every time! Love Keen shoes
review.name: Excellent!

review.reviewBody: I purchased these shoes to walk the rural asphalt roads with gravel shoulders. They have held up greatly with 50+ miles on them. Very little break in period, very comfortable, great support, and plenty of toe box room. I have purchased four other pair of Keen shoes, all of them the same size, including the recent ones.
review.name: Great Shoes

review.reviewBody: These are outstanding, comfortable walking/light hiking shoes! The sole provides outstanding padding, it’s like walking on clouds. The only problem is that after just a month or so, the lining on the shoe came detached inside the heel, so while the shoes were still comfortable, they were no longer waterproof. I let Keen know and they were good enough to issue me a full credit. The same thing happened to the other shoe while I was waiting for them to take action on my first return request. If they ever get the reliability up so the linings don’t tear out of these shoes, they will be the last shoes I ever buy because other than that defect, they are perfect!
review.name: Would be 5 Star, but . . .

review.reviewBody: They look really nice, kuddos to the designer. Unfortunately, they have a poor fit. The toe box had less room then other Keen shoes I've owned. The waterproofing on the inside of the shoe has a seam that rubbed on my heel.
review.name: Underwhelming

review.reviewBody: I love Keen products but I need to return these because I accidentally ordered a 1/2 size too big!
review.name: Too big

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit like a glove and don’t need breaking period! Really satisfied with my purchase.
review.name: Awesome hiking shoes

review.reviewBody: This thing is great. I've used it for anchoring on on multipitches and for cleaning sport routes. It's truly awesome. Because of the length, it can get a little messy on your harness but it's not a big deal for the convenience. review.reviewBody: This jacket is warmer than I expected. I am 5’11” 145lbs ordered a size medium and it works great. Great length in the sleeves. I layer with wool baselayer light fleece and a 60g synthetic puff and have been warm in as low as 20 degrees for skiing and I run cold. I’ve also just worn this shell with wool baselayer when touring and it is definitely holding heat in when you need it and you can open up pit zips to get better airflow. Doesn’t feel like any water will get through the outer shell. I love that the shell also has a little stretch to it. I also have a fly low Lucy jacket and got this one half way through the season and have been leaning for this one especially on milder days or days with any precipitation because it protects better against the elements.
review.name: Warm and breathable

review.reviewBody: I’m 125 lbs, 5’2”, 34D size for reference. This jacket fits my body perfectly. I can wear just a base layer or I have plenty of room for a thick mid layer for the cold days. The breast pocket is deep enough so the phone isn’t hitting my boob in a weird way. All of the pockets are deep and roomy in this jacket, so you can put super big gloves in your pocket when using the restroom and not worry about them falling out. There are a tons of pockets too!! It is super soft inside where I won’t mind wearing a T-shirt on warm days. There are also pit zippers which I know I need, and they have a mesh snow blocker so it doesn’t open too much. The hood has a drawstring all around the front side to easily cinch for the really cold windy days. I returned four other jackets before sticking with this one. I’m stoked to take it to Japan next year.
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.reviewBody: Jacket is well-built with pockets in the right places.  Jacket breaths well and is comfortable.  Only issue is thickness.  I've had shells before but this one is closer to a raincoat than a shell.  Great for those spring days on the slopes but get ready to layer up big time when the weather turns.
review.name: Very nice jacket...  but very thin.

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket. Quality material & lining with a comfortable shell fit. Fits true to size for small build (5'7" 130 lb). The arm pass pocket is a huge plus and multi-tone colors are a fashionable plus. Recommend!
review.name: True to size and made to last

review.reviewBody: Good for the price. I get extra 15% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Very pleased with this.

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite pair of skis. They cruise over everything light and fluffy, and handle the sierra cement with ease. They are quick to respond, and hold a turn with a lot of drive. While they are a powerful ski, they are still fun and playful.
review.name: Love this!

name: Lucy Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I really like the functionality of the bag and so far it has proven to be very easy to use and quite durable. 

This bag would be nearly perfect if it had a waterproof bottom. Instead if any water resistant characteristics, this bag actually soaked up water. I had a very slow and light cooler leak because I didn?t secure the plug all the way.  The bag actually soaked up the water and I just dumped al the tools and parts to make sure everything gets dried to prevent rust. 

It?s not a dealbreaker, but the bag would be significantly more appealing with some water resistant features. Especially on the bottom of the bag; maybe a tub bottom. I expect to set this bag down in wet grass, etc over the years, so I?ll need to find some sort of solution.
review.name: Needs a Water Resistant Bottom

review.reviewBody: Used twice, both times the arm detached from the bike on the highway causing bike to hang on by only tire straps.  First time I said maybe I did something wrong, second time was 100% sure to follow all the instructions , same result, lucky bike and car were ok.
review.name: Maybe mine was defective

review.reviewBody: The first one I purchased we had to return after trying to install the rack for over an hour, the cords that you pull out to attach to the top of your vehicle hatch would not engage to tighten no matter how many knob turns made. The replacement rack had a similar issue on the passanger side and the key wouldn't work in the locks, I had to have my machinist brother file the key down to work and then spend another hour Jimmy rigging the one side to get it to tighten properly. Used the rack for a week long camping trip, the cord on that side keeps going loose. I've had the rack for about a month now and I'm very sad to have spent so much money on such poor quality product.
review.name: Design flaw issues

review.reviewBody: Bought the Thule Platform for our bikes.  While a little hard to install, it was solid on the vehicle.
review.name: Solid fit

review.reviewBody: Love it. you can leave it on the car or once you have it set up it very easy to put on and take off. Also i like that the bikes sit higher so it does not effect review camera.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the product as it has potential to be an excellent solution to not having a hitch, but also not wanting to use the roof rack for my bike. I ordered the rack to the specifications of my 2019 Volvo XC60, and unfortunately it didn’t fit. The hooks don’t fit at the top of the hatch. They need to really be jammed in, which was difficult to do without damaging the car. Once in, the hatch won’t open without damaging the car.

Could potentially be a great solution if it fit properly, which I suspect it does for some cars out there. But not for a volvo xc60.
review.name: Didn’t fit Volvo xc60
comment:
Hello Alex,
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule OutWay Platform. I am sorry to hear about the installation issues you encountered. 
According to compatibility testing by Thule's fit team, the Thule OutWay Platform is compatible with the 2019 Volvo XC60. A member of Thule's Customer Support Team has reached out directly for more information on the situation to see if we can recommend any troubleshooting steps or solutions.

review.reviewBody: I bought this bike rack this spring and I love it. It is mounted on a 2015 Subaru Outback, my roof rack was already loaded with a Thule Force Alpine and the two of them fit well. It cleared my back up camera and plates, bikes hold up tight on any road, take about 15 min to install and adjust and attaching the bike can be tricky sometime, but no big deal. My only negative point is that my hatch doesn’t hold up open when using it (too heavy) and don’t even think to open it with bike. But you adapt!
review.name: Excellent for vehicle without hitch

review.reviewBody: Bought this a few weeks back and very happy with the product. I recommend a second person for installation (mainly to hold the tailgate open slightly) and the rest is a breeze. The removable arms are crucial for attaching and locking your bikes securely no matter the shape of your frame. Feel sturdy and rides smooth on the back of the car. Recommend minor tightening after your first trip to make sure it is settled and secured. Highly recommend for those who don’t have a hitch and need a platform style rack. There is some movement in the platform when driving over bumps, but I feel this is intentional in the design to relieve pressure off the frame. Nothing concerning!
review.name: Perfect for mountain bikes

review.reviewBody: It could work for old cars and old bikes, but not a new car and not for carbon fiber bikes. New car: Rub marks will develop in the paint in six (eight?) locations: 1, 2, 3, 4: the top and bottom of the hatch door, as the strapping stabilizes the rack based on how much torque you create as you cinch the rack down.  5 & 6: The feet that may or may not sit on the spoiler in the middle/lower part of the hatch door. 7 & 8: the spoiler adapter that potentially prevents the spoiler from bending under pressure created by the torqued straps. Not a good design for a Nissan Leaf, although you wouldn't know it by looking at Thule's fit guide (in which I could not find installation instructions). Carbon bike: The rack grips the bike on the down tube. It will crush the carbon fiber over time, as the bikes go jostling up and down dirt roads, even with the adapter they recommend. NOT a good plan. And there is the box the rack came in. 20 years ago I worked for a retailer that sold Thule products: racks and accessories. At that time, many of the boxes came from the distributor THRASHED. The cardboard they used was soft and not well adapted to the products inside. Their boxes also appeared to have been opened and taped shut a second or third time. Tape was all over the box, as if somebody had used packing tape to seal holes and reinforce the boxes. This was frequent. Our Thule rep asked us to focus on the product itself, which really was pretty well designed stuff. Fast forward 20 years. That is EXACTLY how this box was. I repacked it and sealed it with masking tape so that they cannot reuse it and send it out to the (at least) third person.
review.name: I didn't use it but somebody did. I need a hitch.
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule OutWay Platform. I am sorry to hear that you did not have a good experience with the bike rack. 
The Thule OutWay Platform bike clamps have a torque limiting function that, when combined with the Thule Carbon Frame Protector, allows it to safely transport fragile carbon frame bikes. 
The Nissan Leaf is not certified as compatible with any Thule trunk-mounted bike racks. I apologize if that was not made clear while selecting a rack for your vehicle. The product management team has been notified and Thule is making steps to make vehicle outfitting more clear to customers. 
I would also like to apologize for the condition the carton was received in. If the bike rack was purchased through Thule, all shipping damage would be covered under the limited lifetime warranty policy. If the bike rack was purchased through a retailer, I recommend reaching out to them for more information on their damaged shipment policies.

review.reviewBody: Neither the installation video nor the description convey that the rack does NOT work if you have a water cage on the downtube.  You must either remove the cage entirely or remove the upper screw and turn the cage 180 degrees down.  Obviously only an inconvenience (although some possibility that the cage thread will get worn or, worse, misplace the screw), but misleading advertising, IMHO.  Also, carrying 2 bikes does require some advance planning so that you properly position the longer of the 2 clamps.  I didn't want a hitch or roof rack or the variety that hangs the bike.  I've had better prior experiences with Thule.
review.name: Buyer Beware

review.reviewBody: Works great. Very secure. Would travel a thousand miles with my bikes in tow and have no worries. It was difficult ti install though.
review.name: Great Product…Difficult to install

name: OutWay Platform Bike Mount - 2 Bike

hasVariant.name: Couloir Ultralight Harness
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Couloir Ultralight Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Excellent item, got this bunny ear type harness to use over bulky winter layers. It’s super light and pretty easy to put on after staring at the leg loop retention for a couple minutes haha
review.name: Excellent item, got this bunny

review.reviewBody: Keep in mind, this is an ultralight harness, so there’s really no frills. I wouldn’t want to be hanging from this thing all day, but I do trust it to save my life.
review.name: Does the trick

review.reviewBody: Awesome harness, sizing is a bit odd. Leg loops feel unproportionally baggy for the waist.
review.name: Awesome harness

review.reviewBody: Incredibly compact and lightweight. Not a harness I’d want to hang in long, but it’s not designed for that. Great for ski touring.
review.name: As advertised, high quality

review.reviewBody: I hung from this for about 10 minutes seeing if it would cut my circulation off, and was pleasantly surprised. I'll still use a padded harness for most climbing, but the Couloir UL packs dramatically smaller and lighter for alpine use. The design also can be donned without needing to slip over feet, which is really nice if wearing skis or crampons. Make sure to do some local practice before adventures since the design will probably make your tie-in/belay point about 6" higher on your torso than a conventional harness. I was able to do everything normally, my hands were just in different spots and I had to adjust Prussik and ascender strokes for some operations.
review.name: Way more comfortable than expected

review.reviewBody: Ultra lightweight, but not hazing adjustment at the thighs is a bummer
review.name: Lightweight, lacks features

review.reviewBody: Rappel and ice climb TRS with it and it works great. I thought it would have been uncomfortable but it did it with no issue. Very Impressed by that product. It takes so little place an accomplish so much.
review.name: Very impressive

review.reviewBody: The harness is very well designed, strong and incredibly light. The only set back is the lack of padding which can get uncomfortable without proper pants
review.name: Good harness light and compact

review.reviewBody: Packs down smaller than your fist and weighs less than a baseball
review.name: Super light and compact

review.reviewBody: Harness works sweet for rappels into couloirs and packs up smaller than a can of pop. Helpful to have in the bag with some carabiners just in case one needs it.
review.name: Good Harness, what we need it for

name: Couloir Ultralight Harness

review.reviewBody: Every item I have purchased has been great and functional. No regrets with any purchase.
review.name: Mr Ez

review.reviewBody: Great fleece for every day wear, breathable warm and light
review.name: Fleece all around

review.reviewBody: I love these fleeces. Great fit, good color, great feel. I have several.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: Fitted fit throughout and incredibly breathable. Great for plane rides and hikes alike
review.name: Solid Pull Over

review.reviewBody: This is my second Otero fleece, absolutely love the first one!
review.name: Great fit and extremely comfortable

review.reviewBody: I seriously love this. It’s light weight, packs easy, kept me warm but more importantly didn’t make me hot… I feel like this is a balance I find very hard to strike with most fall / winter apparel, so it made me very happy. And it’s just kind of fun that’s its waffle 🧇 patterned on the inside. The thumb holes are also pretty fun. The chest pocket seems more like a fashion statement than a practical item bc even if you put anything as thin as a credit card in there… It’s fully on display. But I can definitely live with that bc everything else about it is AMAZING.
review.name: Perfect fleece

review.reviewBody: This is a great fleece. It may be hard to tell from the photos but the fleece material is on the inside and the outside has more of a smooth athletic texture. It’s very comfortable, aesthetically pleasing, and functional.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: I had already purchased the otero fleece half-zip pullover, and had to get another because I love the style and fit so much. I would recommend this to anyone as the material is soft, breathable, and strong enough to withstand any snags without leaving a mark or tearing the fabric. This lives up to Cotopaxi's incredible quality and design skills!
review.name: Love this style!

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased this fleece and it has quickly become a staple in my outdoor gear. This sweater is not just a piece of clothing, but a reliable companion for all my adventures.

It is perfect for hiking and traveling, providing just the right amount of warmth without compromising on comfort. Its half-zip design allows for easy temperature regulation, making it versatile for varying weather conditions.
I love its ability to transition seamlessly from outdoor adventures to daily use. Whether I’m exploring a mountain trail or running errands in the city, the Otero Fleece fits right in. It’s particularly ideal for the cooler months of autumn and winter, offering cozy warmth that doesn’t feel bulky or restrictive. 

I highly recommend it for anyone who loves outdoor adventures or just wants a cozy sweater for daily wear or even for travels.
review.name: A Perfect Companion for Adventure - The Otero Fleece Half-Zip Pullover

review.reviewBody:
The pullover is great and does the trick on cool spring nights so far!
Great for work and play!
review.name: Perfect spring tag along

name: Otero Fleece Half-Zip Pullover - Men's

description: Buy the MSR PocketRocket Deluxe Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PocketRocket Deluxe Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR PocketRocket Deluxe Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Use this stove for few years. I bought this it was because I didn’t need to bring a lighter. And until the part broken was disappointed so I need to bring a lighter now.
review.name: Love this stove until ignition part broken

review.reviewBody:
Fantastic little canister stove. Has worked well on multiple mountains and also used it in some campgrounds to finish up some of the almost empty canisters. Simmers well so it's usable beyond just boiling water like my windburner does. Light winds are manageable, everything beyond that needs a windscreen or another type of stove.
The only flaw is the piezo igniter which only functions sometimes.
review.name: Compact powerhouse

review.reviewBody: The stove burns well, but after just three days of using my brand new stove the piezo igniter ceased working. Not great in the middle of a 6 day winter walk.
review.name: Piezo failure after three days

review.reviewBody: I loved the convenience of not needing lighter, but, sadly, it doesn't always work, so I have to carry lighter with me anyway
review.name: I loved the convenience of

review.reviewBody: Being an MSR user for the past 30 years, switching to the pocketrocket from my old whisperlite was quite an upgrade! The major improvement was the simmer control that works great and also the fact that I can get this thing working in a matter of seconds :) Thanks for another great product!
review.name: Quite a punch for such a small stove :)

review.reviewBody: I've owned and used dozens of different stoves in 40 years working in the outdoor industry, and this is probably my favorite. Tiny size, easy-lighting, precise heat control, good flame spread, and bombproof build. I bought my first Whisperlite in 1982 when they first came out and have been happily using and abusing MSR products ever since. Can't go wrong.
review.name: My favorite stove

review.reviewBody: There is a reason they sell a of these, it’s a great little stove! The built in regulator really works well.
review.name: Great stove

review.reviewBody: Everything expected for a product from MSR! Works flawlessly.
review.name: Expected from MSR

review.reviewBody:
As the spec says; windproof works well at gentle breeze and that is good enough. 
It is a big bigger that the older model, but works better with bigger pots on. 
The built-in regulator works well in cold temp and even though it wastes some extra gas, it is very helpful and reliable at snow camping and day trip.
The soft pouch is way better than hard plastic box.
One thing can be improved that the tripod support is not strong enough for heavy load. Once i had issue with my Reactor burner, so i put the Reactor pot (1.7L) on this PR Deluxe, and the tripod was tilting sideway and was not stable, so i had to hold the pot the whole time.
review.name: Pocket Rocket Deluxe - support issue

review.reviewBody:
This is the first time using a stove like this. I used it in October on the buffalo river. 
It’s a nice little burner. Small and light. It’s sturdy. I mostly used it to make coffee and it boils water really fast. I will be taking it back on river trips. I don’t backpack but I can see this being part of the pack. You can carry it in your pocket.
review.name: Pocket rocket

name: PocketRocket Deluxe Stove

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Leather Touch-Sensitive Knit Cuff Glove - Women's
review.reviewBody: Because of a mild MN Winter I have had only one opportunity to test out my new gloves.  I purchased them to work outside, shoveling and filling salt and sand buckets for our community.  On a 30-degree day with not wind my fingers were cold in less than a 1/2 hour.  I even had hand warmers inside the gloves.  It was a manageable cold; in that I was able to keep working outside for over 3 hours but did come inside twice for about 10 minutes.  I was really hoping for a better solution to working outside during the winter.  With what I do with the buckets, I really want gloves, not mittens, but I may need to break down and try mittens.

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Leather Touch-Sensitive Knit Cuff Glove - Women's
review.reviewBody: It was women's. Don't fit. Didn't say it was womens
review.name: Don't fit

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Leather Touch-Sensitive Knit Cuff Glove - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm and durable work gloves. Using them for playing in the snow with the kids and they’re great.
review.name: Great winter gloves

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Leather Touch-Sensitive Knit Cuff Glove - Women's
review.reviewBody: Not very warm. They look, feel, and fit like a winter glove but no good sub freezing for more than 10-15 minutes. Unfortunate, really. Build quality seems good but I won't be getting much use out of them.
review.name: Not warm

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Leather Touch-Sensitive Knit Cuff Glove - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm and well-fitting.  I wear them when riding my bicycle in New York City.  I like them.  The fingers stay in place when I remove them even when  my hands get sweaty.

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Leather Touch-Sensitive Knit Cuff Glove - Women's
review.reviewBody: With most other gloves I usually need to buy replacements every 3-4 weeks due to using them for frequent salt throwing at work. These have just passed the 1 month mark and are showing no signs of tearing other than the leather strip that runs up the cuff. Typically the first place my gloves wear out is in the fingers but these are holding up well in that area. I do notice a lump in the tip of the right index finger, I am not sure if that is material from the gloves or if it is a piece of salt that somehow made its way in. Overall great gloves and I will be buying these from now on. The touch screen compatible finger tip actually works, I have had many gloves that do not work on touch screens even when advertised as such.
review.name: More durable than other brands

name: Insulated Leather Touch-Sensitive Knit Cuff Glove - Women's

review.name: Great & comfy sandal

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was expecting. Great sandal for the river
review.name: Exactly what I was expecting. Great sandal for the

review.reviewBody: I was so excited when I bought these because my previous pair of chacos were worn regularly for 10 years and just now fell apart. But I swear the straps on these are uneven, the straps on the right foot are so much longer than the left foot. No matter who I have adjust them they can never fit right, both shoes end up fitting differently not to mention the straps right around the ankles/behind the ankles can’t adjust to fit my ankles. It’s really upsetting to see a shoe brand I really like have shoes that can’t adjust like they say they should. Besides that they still are comfortable to walk in, but I will have to find a different sandal  and return these
review.name: Doesn’t adjust right

review.reviewBody: I bought this purse to keep my phone handy during daily walks and hikes. I wanted to have my phone close enough to my ears to listen to music, but I prefer not to wear earpods or headphones for safety reasons. This purse is perfect—it keeps my phone close, allowing me to enjoy music while staying aware of my surroundings. I absolutely love it!
review.name: Love this pouch!!

review.reviewBody: Plenty of pockets and space for a passport, cards/$ and my phone, plus a sneaky pocket on the back. My water bottle spilled on it and my things stayed dry. Great product.
review.name: Neck pouch

review.reviewBody: Not only is this a handy pouch for stashing a few essentials on an errand, but it works to hold my phone - when listening to audio books - closer to my ears for times I don't want to wear headphones.
review.name: Neck pouch does double-duty

review.reviewBody: Great for days when all I need is my phone and a wallet. I wish the neck cord was a little more substantial, but otherwise love it.
review.name: Cute small pouch/purse

review.reviewBody: At the time I was in need of something small to carry only the items I absolutely needed to carry, nothing more. I was in travel status at the time. Now that I am home, I have switched back to a slightly larger pouch for daily use. The Cotopaxi is now in my suitcase, waiting for my next journey. Thanks.
review.name: Mango Neck Pouch

review.reviewBody: The neck pouch is the best! I’m on my second one since my first one wore out! Handy, and cute too!
review.name: Neck Pouch

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my planned travels. It’s perfect for holding passport and for easy reach. I like it being light weight as well.
review.name: Pouch - Del Dia

review.reviewBody: This fits more than I thought. Wish the color combo I got was better. It will work great for carrying photo passport around your neck like a lanyard
review.name: Neat little bag

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect little purse/pouch for lightweight travel! For festivals, it holds everything I need for the day.The 4 pockets make it easy to find what I need without rummaging, and my phone is easy to grab in the outside pocket. Top flap is very secure with velcro closure, and the color is great. I love it!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I bought this little pouch for the music festival I’m going to next three days. I wasn’t realized there are so many rooms in. It’s a perfect size for a wallet, phone and id. That’s all I need. I like to be hands off when I’m dancing and that will do the job. It’s also very colorful and will match pretty much everything.
review.name: My new little bag

name: Maigo Del Dia Neck Pouch
