hasVariant.description: Buy the Peak Design Universal Adapter online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: While this is secure, my iPhone 16 Pro Max cannot charge wirelessly with this adapter. It blocks the RF charging.
review.name: No wireless charging

review.reviewBody: My wife needs a more protective case than the Peak Design provides but I wanted to move to  PD vent-mount phone holder. By carefully cutting a matching hole in the back of the rubber outer case I was able to attach the “universal” phone mount to a compatible surface. Note: you keep using that word (universal). I do not think it means what you think it means. This retrofit works great and almost looks like it was designed this way!
review.name: Otterbox Defender retrofit

review.reviewBody: The magnet is very strong and secure! However, the adhesive (that sticks the adapter to the wall/surface) has come off the surface a few times.
review.name: Strong magnet but weak adhesive

review.reviewBody:
I bought this because nobody makes a mount case yet for the Pixel 8A (and nobody seems to have a plan to). 

I was worried it wouldn't stick well, or that it would be hard to apply without it being crooked. 

However I was wrong. Instructions were solid, the guide ensured it was straight. And finally, i can practically lift my bike with it.
review.name: Wasn't Sure It Would Be Good

review.reviewBody: I purchased this to use with my Peak Design Evotech Fuel Tank mount with an S20 with Tech21 cover. I was hesitant to use it on the Tech21 cover as it is semi flexible. After mounting to the cover, waiting 48hours (instructions are 24hrs), and going on a few short trips it has held up. Now, I have logged over 2k miles with this attached to my cover on the motorcycle and it is holding strong. I am quite surprised at the 3M tape holding as I have had issues with this tape holding inside vehicles and not exposed like on a motorcycle. No problems to report. I am happy with this mount and will purchase other mounts when I change phones.
review.name: Works on a Motorcycle

review.reviewBody: Easy install on my Moto 5G case. Stays in place with no vibration just like my iPhone 12.
review.name: Works Great!

review.reviewBody: I bought this to convert a phone to a dedicated dirt biking computer, haven't had the chance to go for a ride yet but it does feel sturdy and the magnets are pretty strong.
review.name: Great universal https://trk.klclick.com/lsproduct

review.reviewBody: I use it for the motorcycle mount and it works good. To be honest I'm scared in case it detaches from the case, but it doesn't look like it's gonna happen.
review.name: Really discreet

review.reviewBody: Works really well, looks nice and so far has been pretty durable. If I had any comments it would be that I would have liked some colors/finish options. I have a white phone, would have liked a white finish so it didn't stand out as much.
review.name: Works Well

review.reviewBody: I love the way the universal adapter has performed so far! It is attached to my Pixel 6a TPU slim case. There was not a case available for this phone. I followed the directions for attaching the adapter to the case and the results are bombproof! I attach it to the universal bar mount so I can switch out bikes easily. I use it on my all road bike on gravel and chipseal roads and on gravel and multi-use trails on our tandem.. It is secure and has proven to be bombproof on bigger bumps/potholes. The glue used is very strong and secure. Great product and great value!
review.name: Exceeds expectations!

name: Universal Adapter

hasVariant.name: Dura-Ace WH-R9270 C36 Carbon Road Wheelset - Tubeless
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano Dura-Ace WH-R9270 C36 Carbon Road Wheelset - Tubeless online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Dura-Ace WH-R9270 C36 Carbon Road Wheelset - Tubeless
review.reviewBody: I bought these wheels a couple of weeks ago and installed them on my 2024 Trek Domane SL and liked them so much that I bought another set for my other Domane SLR. These wheels excel in acceleration, stability in the wind and especially when climbing! which I do alot of. The hubs are buttery smooth and whisper quiet which I love, not a fan of the loud ratcheting sound that most traditional hubs make. The wheels have been setup as tubeless with 78-80 psi in the rear and 72-75 psi for the front. If you're priorities when looking for a new wheelset is to climb like a mountain goat or spool up to speed quickly then you'd be hard press to find better wheels for the money, CC had them on sale recently, so it was a great deal and totally worth the upgrade!
review.name: Great light weight wheelset!

review.itemreviewed: Dura-Ace WH-R9270 C36 Carbon Road Wheelset - Tubeless
review.reviewBody: Nice and light, roll true, but wish the rear hub was smoother.  I’ve always judged wheels on how well the rear hub spins when it’s sitting in the stand and you free wheel it.  These are sluggish and I can’t help but think it slows you down when riding.  I’ve experienced the same thing with my Zipp 303, but I was hoping these would be better.  Comparatively, my Hunt rear wheel will spin forever.
review.name: Good Wheels

name: Dura-Ace WH-R9270 C36 Carbon Road Wheelset - Tubeless

comment: We are sorry to hear that you never received your purchase. This is not the experience we want for our customers. We've sent you an email so we can look into this further and resolve the issue.

review.itemreviewed: Jackal II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Well-designed shoe. Love the weight, minimalist uppers, protective midsole and sticky outsole. Classic Sportiva in terms of thoughtful design and build quality. 

True to size, but the fit is unusual for Sportiva: as advertised, these are wider and higher-volume than most Sportiva designs. My feet are narrow and low volume; my feet are happy all day in a pair of Bushidos, and Akashas feel perfectly roomy for high-mileage trips. As a result, I find the fit of the Jackals is loose and sloppy, with problematic bunching of the upper material when I tighten the laces. FYI for other folks with similarly-shaped feet.

TL;DR -- these are wider and higher-volume than classic Sportiva designs; would recommend to anyone who usually finds Sportiva shoes too narrow or low-volume for their feet.
review.name: Unusual fit for Sportiva

name: Jackal II Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Merino 260 Quantum Long-Sleeve Zip Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this as a replacement to one I had for a few years. Loved wearing it on airplanes and chilly mornings around the house. The new one I bought is quite noticeably a different quality. The fabric is thinner. Zipper was full metal on previous one. Now it's plastic. The overall quality just feels...less. Of course the price tag is EXACTLY THE SAME. Go figure. Had the same issue recently with another outdoor gear company. If these companies are going to send us less, charge us less!!
review.name: Quality has diminished Odeon previous model

name: Merino 260 Quantum Long-Sleeve Zip Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought them for my daughter‘s boyfriends for Christmas and one of them said best sweatshirt they’ve ever owned
review.name: Hoodies

review.reviewBody: I’m 6’1” and 193lbs and the large fits great. It is a garment with the Backcountry label. I went for an evening walk in 45F temps with a Helly Hansen full zip up hoodie over this (left open) and I felt cold air hitting my chest. It’s a comfy hoodie but it’s not going to keep you warm even as a mid layer. I bought it on sale and will not consider a Backcountry label garment for outdoor activities. I have to call out that it’s 2024 and BC still makes you pay for shipping returns back when they are an online clothing store. Bobo tactics get bobo reviews.
review.name: Comfy, not warm

name: Meltdown Water-Resistant Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: Recently purchased this jacket to have on hand for light rainy days especially for softball/baseball games. I ordered a Medium for layering underneath and it fits perfect (typically am a S). Love the green color, material, and overall fit.
review.name: Perfect Jacket

review.reviewBody: Seems like a good quality jacket. Haven't worn it yet. Don't like the "side vents", they are zippers on the side of the jacket that have to be zipped all the way up to vent your armpits. So now if  it is windy out the jacket is going to flap in the wind. Wish the zippers were from the waist up, that way when working out in the rain and I start to get warm the whole side wouldn't be open
review.name: Vents too big

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket to replace my old one and really happy with it.  Used it for 5 day backpacking trip and it worked well in windy and cold conditions.  It also seems lightweight compared to my other jacket.
review.name: Great jacket for rain and cold

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Camped comfortably 2 nights in 7°F wind chill (20°F low temp) on the Appalachian Trail in Georgia in February. I wore my puffer coat & thermal layers in a 4 season tent as one does in such weather.  Pack weight at 2.8lb was perfect, Marmot is such solid quality, I've had a fleece for 20 years, this bag will go the distance
review.name: 7°F no problem

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used this for a week-long backpacking trip in 2021 and was really happy w/ the quality, how well it compacts down, and the overall comfort.  Bought two more for other family members.
review.name: Great for backpacking

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for a fall camping trip to Acadia National park, and despite the cool nights, it kept me nice and warm. The light weight is a nice bonus to for some backpacking trips I’m planning next year.
review.name: Definitely a warm night’s sleep

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Worked great.  Was very warm and compacts very small.
review.name: Elite Eco 30

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this for Spring-Fall camping/backpacking. In the stuff sack fits well in my pack and very light-weight. Used in summer nights that got down to only 50, felt comfortable with the sack partially opened, and in autumn when it got down to mid-30s with it still keeping me warm.
review.name: Great 3 season sleeping bag

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Very lightweight but large enough for me to fit into at 6ft and ~200lbs. I have the large and it fits well. If you have very wide shoulders or like to toss and turn, I could see it being tight.
review.name: Tres Elites

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: I used this bag for the first 3 months of my Appalchain Trail thru-hike. I was only cold when the temperature went below 30, however I also used a liner. So if your not expecting freezing temps, this bag is a great ratio of warmth, weight, and price
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used this bag several times now and it's pretty solid. Lightweight and packable, I like the additional zipper on the opposite side that allows the top to fold down like a blanket.
review.name: Lightweight and packable

name: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to be able to fit into these so bad as they look awesome and have all the features I was looking for an all around gym shoe. Unfortunately they are way too narrow and the heel cup too deep for me to fit. If I pushed my toe all the way up I had almost an inch of room in the heel. You need a long narrow foot with a distinct heel for these to fit right. 

For reference, I wear size 10-10.5 street shoe, 42-43 in LaSpo (depending on the shoe) and ordered these in 10.5.
review.name: Well Built Shoe, Weird Fit

review.reviewBody: I sized up and they were still very stiff and very small. My big toe was almost totally bent.
review.name: Runs very small

name: Catch Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I love the Ghost whisperer jackets. Fits just like I wanted , roomy enough for clothing underneath. I ordered Lg.in the Jack Pine color  -(I am 5'7 145lbs.) My only small complaint is the color.  I had to order on line since it wasn't in stock.  It looks like a blue color online, when in fact it's green!  I'm okay with the NEW color.  But just saying..... buyer beware.
review.name: jack Pine is green

review.reviewBody: Light weight while down fluffy, extra warm, fits well, pulls off style and color pops! It’s as stylish and comfortable as it is practical and warm.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: These are the best for layering. I’m a typical large and have this in large to wear as a mid layer. This time I ordered an XL to wear as outer layer. Love both, warm, pack down small, light, perfect for travel.
review.name: Perfect layer

review.reviewBody: Love the color and the fit. It’s very lightweight, yet warm. I’m going to get a lot of wear out of this coat!
review.name: Beautiful coat

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and nice looking! I highly recommend
review.name: Warm and Durable

review.reviewBody: Love the featherweight lightness of this jacket. And yet it's really warm! I have long arms and this coat is perfect in sleeve length too. This is my second ghost whisperer coat. I misplaced my first one which I had for at least 3 years and was devastated, so I immediately bought another. And yes, I ended up finding the other one about a month later, so now I have 2 color options. Win win!
review.name: Lightweight and WARM

review.reviewBody: This jacket is a replacement for one that I purchased many years ago.  I absolutely love it!   It is super light weight and is a great jacket for cold weather.  Wear a layer or two under it and it can be used on a very cold day!  Looks great and love the color.
review.name: Wonderful jacket!!!

review.reviewBody: I really have enjoyed my Ghost Whisperer jacket. It is so light but warm. It is great for traveling as it is light and packs in suck a small area. It seems perfect whether it is just cool or very cold.
review.name: Perfect for Me

name: Ghost Whisperer Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great size! Not too small and not too large and bulky. Makes it convenient to have personal necessities, without needing a purse or large bag.
review.name: Glad I made this purchase

review.reviewBody: Love it! Was what I expected. Big enough to carry my personal belongings and small enough to be comfortable.
review.name: I liked this product a lot!

review.reviewBody: This is a great, functional bag that I've quickly fallen in love with. I traveled through Europe with this and now use it daily to keep track of phone, keys, wallet, kids snacks, glasses, etc. The size feels perfect, if it were any bigger I'd put more in it and it would be too heavy. Material is soft but durable. I've been reading that people complain about the logo tag on the front being flimsy, which isn't correct-and these people don't understand TNF legacy products. A few flaws -the material inside is loose and catches on the zipper when they are all the way on the right or the left. -the strap could be 1/4" wider
review.name: Great bag, a few flaws

review.reviewBody: Looks like good and fabric also as expected. But this bag capacity was a little small for me.
review.name: I would like to buy one more big size

review.reviewBody: This bag held my essential things, perfect for my trip to the amusement park. Held my phone with the case on it, wallet, keys and lotion. Still had room for something else if needed.
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody: Bought for a travel crossbody and it's perfect. It holds necessities plus a bit and is lightweight. It offers protection from rain and splashing. Great bag.
review.name: Would buy again

review.reviewBody: Just the right size to carry essential items. Phone, wallet, keys
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody: My wife uses this product for her everyday bag. She loves it! She says that she gets a lot of compliments when she wears it.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again.

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my wife she loves it! Can't stop wearing and she says she gets a lot of compliments about it.
review.name: I would definitely buy again

review.reviewBody: Super cute but poor strap design. Once I extended the straps, they kept slipping/did not stay at the desired length so I had to keep adjusting and/or the straps were dangling and flapping around. Also the clips that attach the strap to the bag could be improved. I have other brands that have a better design. Had to return
review.name: Not a fan but cute pattern

name: Berkeley Lumbar Pack
